summary: This document is an email chain from September 2020 regarding the FBI's sensitivity review of a draft Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) report concerning the DOJ's handling of the Jeffrey Epstein investigation from 2006-2008. The FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit in New York is asked to review the report to ensure its public release does not impact ongoing investigations or the FBI's '7A' position (likely a reference to privacy or law enforcement exemptions).

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
persons.context: The primary reviewer of the OPR draft report, providing feedback that victim interview FBI serials are referenced but not publicly released, and that the report does not impact the '7A response'.

persons.name: Unit Chief Litigation Support Unit/RIDS
persons.context: Coordinates the review of the OPR draft report, communicates deadlines, and liaises with the OPR and other FBI units.

persons.name: Government Information Specialist LSURIDS/INID
persons.context: Sends a follow-up email regarding the OPR report review deadline and includes a standard confidentiality statement.

persons.name: Counsel Office of Professional Responsibility S. Department of Justice
persons.context: Transmits the draft OPR report to the FBI for a sensitivity review, as indicated in the forwarded message from September 2, 2020.

persons.name: Assistant Director and General Counsel Office of General Counsel FBI Headquarters
persons.role: FBI Assistant Director and General Counsel
persons.context: Listed as a recipient in the initial OPR transmittal email, indicating high-level oversight of the review.

connections.person1: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
connections.description: Collaborating on the review of the OPR draft report, with the Unit Chief managing the process and the Special Agent providing substantive feedback.

connections.description: OPR Counsel transmits a sensitive draft report to the FBI's General Counsel for review, indicating an official inter-agency communication.

personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking

keyFacts: The DOJ's Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) prepared a draft report investigating the handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter by the Southern District of Florida during 2006-2008.

The FBI's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit in New York was tasked with a sensitivity review to ensure the report's release would not impact ongoing investigations or the FBI's legal position (referred to as '7A').

The FBI reviewer noted that the draft report contained footnotes referencing FBI serials of victim interviews, but confirmed those serials were not publicly released and the report would not compromise the '7A response'.
The email chain reveals internal FBI and DOJ procedures for reviewing sensitive reports prior to public release, highlighting concerns about protecting investigative details and victim information.
